thread.title: Russell Westbrook gets 25th triple-double of the season | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Russell Westbrook gets 25th triple-double of the season | NBA | Sporting News

author: Alec Brzezinski Omnisport
title: Russell Westbrook gets 25th triple-double of the season | NBA | Sporting News
text:
February 4, 2017 12:30am EST February 4, 2017 12:30am EST Basketball, NBA, News, English, Russell Westbrook Westbrook has 25 triple-doubles this season, and the rest of the league has just 36 combined. Russell Westbrook (Getty Images) 
Updated at 12:30 a.m. ET 
Updated at 12:30 a.m. ET 
Stop the presses: Russell Westbrook recorded yet another triple-double. 
Why is this one somewhat special? Well, it was his 25th of the season, and he scored 38 points with 13 rebounds and 12 assists in a 114-102 win against the Grizzlies. 
MORE: Rockets retire Yao Ming's No. 11 jersey 
The mercurial point guard often faces criticism for inefficient play, causing too many turnovers and forcing shots, but he proved Friday night that he can be a great leader, too. 
Thunder center Steven Adams added a double-double, scoring 16 points with 13 rebounds. He has been a steady presence for Oklahoma City this season. 
Memphis was led by underrated All-Star center Marc Gasol, who scored 31 points with eight assists. He has developed into one of the best, true centers int he NBA, and may even give his famous brother's career a run for its money. 
Studs of the Night: 
Isaiah Thomas continued his electric form by scoring 38 points with four assists in a 113-107 win against the Lakers. Thomas has now scored 35-plus points in four straight games, which is the longest streak by a Celtic since Paul Pierce did it four in a row in 2001. 
Pistons stars Marcus Morris and Andre Drummond led the Pistons to a 116-108 win against the Timberwolves. Morris scored 38 points with six rebounds and Drummond added 12 points and 18 rebounds. Drummond now has 32 double-doubles on the season, which is tied with Dwight Howard for the fifth-most in the league. 
James Harden exploded once again to score 42 points with 12 rebounds and nine assists in a 121-117 overtime win against the Bulls. The only engative, he shot just 13 of 33 from the field. 
Dud of the Night: 
Kyle Lowry struggled to get anything going in a 102-94 loss against the Magic by scoring just 18 points on 5 of 20 shooting. He did add seven assists and five rebounds, but with DeMar DeRozan out yet again with an ankle injury, Toronto needs more out of its All-Star point guard. 
Highlight: 
Nuggets forward Nikola Jokic shows off his arm strength to record his first-career triple-double. ...and Nikola got his first triple-double IN STYLE. — Denver Nuggets (@nuggets) February 4, 2017 
Jokic finished the 121-117 win with 20 points, 13 rebounds and 11 assists. 
What's Next: 
Cavaliers (33-15) at Knicks (22-29) 8:30 p.m. ET — Cleveland versus New York brings together two disappointed fan bases expecting more out of their teams at this point in the season. LeBron James and company have been playing better lately, but Carmelo Anthony may come to play in a defacto audition. Watch This
